subject: Productivity
title: Shame and the Procrastination Spiral
description: A short lesson to help you apply Shame and the Procrastination Spiral.

hook.text: You delay a task. Then you feel guilty. The guilt makes you avoid it more. The spiral begins.

buildup.text: Shame is one of the most paralyzing emotions. It turns a missed deadline into an identity crisis.

discovery.text: Researchers found that self-forgiveness after procrastination reduces future procrastination.

twist.text: Beating yourself up doesn't help. It adds emotional weight that makes the next start even harder.

climax.text: Self-compassion breaks the spiral. Acknowledging the slip without judgment frees you to begin again.

punchline.text: Forgive the delay. Then start fresh.

quiz.question: What did researchers find about self-forgiveness and procrastination?
